Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulet
Description: Small amulet with two differently treated surfaces: one flat and one shaped like a seated female deity whose head is crowned by a pair of horns encircling the solar disc. Her left arm supports a child sitting sideways on her lap. The representation portrays the goddess Isis suckling Horus. A suspension hole is pierced through the amulet at the bottom of the headdress.
